Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller

Klasse UsernameMenuController

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.Controller
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.controller.UsernameMenuController
public class UsernameMenuController extends Controller
Controller for the "Username Menu" of the Minesweeper application.

This menu allows the user to change their username, ensuring valid input (1-16 characters, no spaces). The updated username is saved in the user data. The menu provides options to return to the main menu or save the new username.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • UsernameMenuController

      public UsernameMenuController(String username, String style, boolean muted)
      Constructs a new UsernameMenuController with the specified username, style, and mute settings.

      This constructor initializes the controller with the player's username, the chosen visual style, and whether sound effects are muted.

      Parameter:
      username - The username of the player.
      style - The visual style of the menu (e.g., "retro", "modern").
      muted - true if sound effects are muted, false otherwise.

  • Methodendetails

    • start

      public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
      Starts the UsernameMenuController and initializes the username menu interface.

      This method sets up the stage and initializes all required UI elements for the username menu. If the sound is not muted, background music specific to the username menu is played. The stage is prepared and the window layout is initialized.

      Parameter:
      stage - The Stage instance used to display the username menu.

    • initializeUserElements

      private void initializeUserElements()
      Initializes all user interface elements for the username menu.

      This method sets up the text field for entering the username, the save button, the return button, and the container for organizing these buttons.

    • initializeWindow

      private void initializeWindow()
      Initializes and configures the main window layout for the username menu.

      This method sets up the root container, applies layout properties, adds user interface elements such as the username text field and button box, and loads the appropriate stylesheets. Finally, it sets the scene and switches to the username menu.

    • initializeUsernameTextField

      private void initializeUsernameTextField()
      Initializes the username text field for the username menu.

      This method sets up the text field where the user can enter their username. It configures placeholder text, input validation, and visual properties such as width.

    • initializeSaveUsernameButton

      private void initializeSaveUsernameButton()
      Initializes the "Save Username" button in the username menu.

      This method sets up the button for saving the entered username. It configures properties such as focus behavior and enables the button's action to save the username when clicked. Initially, the button is disabled.

    • initializeReturnButton

      private void initializeReturnButton()
      Initializes the "Return" button in the username menu.

      This method sets up the button that allows the user to return to the main menu. It configures properties such as focus behavior and enables the button's action to navigate back to the previous menu when clicked.

    • initializeButtonBox

      private void initializeButtonBox()
      Initializes the button box container for the username menu.

      This method creates a horizontal box layout to organize the "Save Username" and "Return" buttons. It sets spacing between the buttons and aligns them at the center of the container.

    • validateInput

      private void validateInput()
      Validates the input in the username text field.

      This method checks whether the entered username meets the following criteria:

      • It is not empty.
      • Its length does not exceed 16 characters.
      • It does not contain any spaces.
      If the input is invalid, the "Save Username" button is disabled.

    • saveUsername

      private void saveUsername()
      Saves the entered username and returns to the main menu.

      This method retrieves the text from the username text field, trims any unnecessary whitespace, and updates the username. The updated username is then saved using the UserDataManager. After saving, the user is redirected to the main menu.

    • returnToMenu

      private void returnToMenu()
      Returns to the main menu.

      This method stops the background music currently playing in the username menu and initializes a new MenuController to display the main menu.

      public boolean isMuted()
      Checks if the sound effects are muted in the username menu.

    • setMuted

      public void setMuted(boolean muted)
      Sets whether the sound effects should be muted in the username menu.
      Parameter:
      muted - true to mute sound effects, false to enable them.
